After Anchorage summit, Europeans stand firmly behind Zelensky in the face of Trump
subhead: Several leaders from across Europe are set to travel to Washington on Monday with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky to meet with the American president. The Ukrainian crisis now pits Kyiv and the main European governments against Moscow and Washington.

title: Bolivia's divided left risks losing elections after 20 years of dominance
subhead: On August 17, Bolivians will vote in the first round of presidential and parliamentary elections. The left appears set to pay the price for the economic crisis and internal infighting, as former president Evo Morales has been barred from running.
byline: By Amanda Chaparro (Patamanta and Batallas (La Paz Department), special correspondent)

title: India and Pakistan, like Israel and Palestine, remain locked in their founding disputes
subhead: While it is important not to conflate the two, certain similarities are evident in the trajectory of these two seemingly interminable crises, historian Jean-Pierre Filiu writes in his column.

title: Soviet-era relics in Kazakhstan rescued from ruin
subhead: The monumental mosaics and frescoes adorning public buildings in the former Soviet republic are at risk of disappearing and initiatives to restore these works of art are proliferating.

title: 'Who will survive?': How 'Game of Thrones' staged an unprecedented bloodbath
subhead: 'Breaking the Script' (4/5). On June 2, 2013, the end of the third season of 'Game of Thrones' stunned viewers by depicting the brutal murder of one of the saga's houses, in an episode that immediately went viral on social media. The carnage sparked a trend of aestheticized violence in television fiction series. Spoiler alert!

byline: By Vincent Fagot and Jordan Pouille (Beijing (China), correspondent)

title: Urban forests spread their cover in a time of climate change
subhead: Many local French authorities have implemented their own 'tree plan' or 'canopy plan' to increase greenery in cities. However, there is a risk that these initiatives amount to mere publicity stunts or that the trees do not have proper conditions to thrive.

title: In France, accessible beaches help 'normalize vacations' for all
subhead: The 'Handiplage' label, awarded to 150 beaches across France, guarantees people with reduced mobility access to the water and amphibious wheelchairs for swimming.
